results.title: Hamlet (Perspective)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Shakespeare in Perspective Series”.
Designed to give a greater understanding and appreciation of the play by placing it in its historical and social context and by stressing its relevance for a modern-day audience. Perspective offered by Clive James, writer and broadcaster.

results.title: Hamlet (Olivier)
results.brief_description: Olivier’s version of Hamlet was described by him as “an essay in Hamlet”. The text has been dramatically cut, the order transposed in places, and some new implications worked into the action.

constellations_other.name: A world of firsts
constellations_other.description: There’s a first time for everything. In their own way, these films, television and videogames each broke ground.

results.description: Olivier’s version of Hamlet was described by him as “an essay in Hamlet”. The text has been dramatically cut, the order transposed in places, and some new implications worked into the action. Technically the film makes use of a number of camera devices, particularly the travelling camera. The characterization does not depart from the traditional.

results.title: Hamersley 70
results.brief_description: A Survey of the Hamersley Range iron mining operations. Includes scenes of the excavation of the ore from Mount Tom Price, the 182 mile railway to Dampier - the port from which iron pellets are exported all over the world.

results.title: Hamersley '66
results.creator_credit: Lilias Fraser, Norman Castle and Fraser Castle Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the construction of an iron ore mine at Mount Tom Price in the Hamersley Range of Western Australia. In 1962 enormous high grade ore deposits were discovered, Hamersley Iron was contracted to supply ore to Japan in 1966. The silence of the arid red land was shattered by immense pieces of machinery feverishly working to meet the deadline.

results.title: Hamburger
results.brief_description: Hamburger focuses on the fast food industry; providing an insight into the two largest hamburger chains in the world; MacDonalds and Burger King. These two fast food chains have made a dramatic impact, not only on the food industry itself; but on the social and economic lives of individuals. The fast food market has been revolutionised into an industrial process which has had a serious impact on the environment. A powerful documentary in two episodes: Big Mac” and “International Mincemeat.

results.title: Halprin: collective creativity
results.brief_description: Lawrence Halprin, environmental designer, explains his successful approach designing cities for the care and feeding of people, rather than the care and feeding of automobiles. His “take part” workshops draw people together to create their own consensus of how they want their cities to change or be revitalised
results.description: Lawrence Halprin, environmental designer, explains his successful approach designing cities for the care and feeding of people, rather than the care and feeding of automobiles. results.title: Hallo: communications in a nutshell
results.creator_credit: Jehangir Bhownagary, Bucharest Studios and Unesco
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon film giving a brief popular outline of the history of communications from signal drums to satellite relaying. No commentary - music by Dumitru Capoianu.

results.title: Halley
results.creator_credit: Terence Murtagh and York Films of England
results.brief_description: Provides a historical look at Halley’s Comet; considers work of Halley; notes popularity of comet watching in eighteenth and nineteenth century and briefly shows how NASA space vehicle “Giotto” will rendezvous with Halley’s comet in 1986.

results.title: Hallelujah Darwin!
results.creator_credit: Kip Cates, Robert Brandreth-Gibbs and Magic Lantern
results.brief_description: The biography of Charles Darwin is told using animated characters. His educational and religious background is followed by his voyage with reasons for the development of his theory of natural selection.
